title: Under-fire Apprentice star Lottie Lion boasted 'her dad is pals with Lord Sugar'
text:

Lottie Lion has reportedly upset a number of her rivals on The Apprentice by claiming her dad was pals with Lord Sugar.

The 19-year-old candidate has proved to be a controversial presence in the process of the BBC show and reportedly alienated the others further with claims about how close her dad was to the man who could ultimately hire or fire.

Lottie has boasted about her privileged background and an insider has said that others in the process found her "unbearable" and would go to any lengths to avoid sharing a vehicle with her as the series progressed.

Speaking to The Sun, the insider said that Lottie "managed to rub everyone up the wrong way from the start, particularly in the house where tempers were often running very high after tasks."

(Image: BBC/Boundless)

(Image: lottie.lion/Instagram)

It would be at this point that her background would rile other candidates in the process as Lottie "would brag about the country club she belonged to and she was always saying how you had to have loads of money to even be considered as a member."

There was a perception that she was "looking down her nose at everyone else."

The differences were exacerbated when it was revealed that Lottie's dad "runs a company that books Lord Sugar for speeches."

(Image: PA)

(Image: BBC/Boundless)

This rubbed up others in the process who were reportedly unhappy that Lottie was "seemingly having a foot up."

Claims about the closeness of Lord Sugar and Lottie's father were refuted by the billionaire entrepreneur.

Lottie's father, Dominique Lion, runs Leaders For Business, who have boasted that Lord Sugar is just one of a number of inspirational speakers that can be hired.

A spokesman for Lord Sugar has shot down any connection, telling The Sun: "He doesn’t know him. He has never heard of him. There’s no connection between them.”

description: Teenage candidate on The Apprentice has proved to be a 'difficult character' to deal with and alienated many of her rivals
